Question: You are the driver of the blue car. Of the 4 hazards marked, which one is most likely to require you to take urgent action?
What is the maximum distance a load may overhang your vehicle behind the rear axle?
Does the driver of the blue car have to give way?
At night, you MUST always dip the headlights on your vehicle when:
When are you allowed to pass another vehicle?

Answers.Answer: When you are coming up to a blind corner or blind bend
When a vehicle has stopped at a pedestrian crossing
When you can see at least 100 metres of clear road in front of you once you have finished passing
When you are less than 10 metres away from a railway level crossing

Question: On a Transit Lane sign, what does T2 mean?

Answers.Answer: Vehicles that use the lane must have at least two people.
Vehicles that use the lane must have two passengers
Only two vehicles are permitted on the transit lane at any time
There are two transit lanes ahead

Question: You are in the left-hand lane at traffic signals. You are waiting to turn left. At which of these traffic signals may you move on?
What should you do when you are coming up to traffic signals and the signals change from green to yellow?

Answers.Answer: Stop at the signals if you can do so safely
Speed up before the light changes to red
Stop even if it means stopping in the middle of the intersection
Turn hard to the left and stop around the corner

Question: What should you do when following another vehicle in wet conditions?

Answers.Answer: Drive closer to the vehicle so that you can follow in its tracks
Drive with your vehicle handbrake on

Question: The bonnet of your vehicle lifts up while you are driving and you cannot see. What should you do?

Answers.Answer: Turn your vehicle headlights on and look out of the side window
Brake smoothly and move over to the left side of the road
Steer your vehicle straight ahead and stop as quickly as you can
Speed up and move to the left side of the road

Question: When coming up to a one-lane bridge, what does this sign indicate?

Answers.Answer: Others should give way to you

Question: What colour is the line painted on a sealed road at a Give Way sign?
You wish to turn left at the intersection. What should you do?

Answers.Answer: Speed up and turn in front of the cyclist
Sound the warning device to warn the cyclist
Stay back until the cyclist has passed the intersection
Keep driving to the next intersection

Does the driver of the blue car have to give way?
When should you use your hazard lights?

Answers.Answer: When your vehicle becomes a temporary hazard to other road users
When approaching an accident scene to warn other drivers
When reversing from a driveway and your view is not clear

Question: What does this sign mean?

Answers.Answer: You may stop your vehicle if there are no buses coming
You may stop your vehicle between 6pm and 8am except on Fridays and Saturdays
You may stop your vehicle if someone stays with it
You may not stop your vehicle at any time

Question: Does the driver of the blue car have to give way?
You are the driver of the blue car. What must you do?

Answers.Answer: Speed up to get around in front of the cyclist
Keep driving as the cyclist has to give way to larger vehicles
Sound the warning device to warn the cyclist
Stop and give way to the cyclist

check with an authorised vehicle inspection centre
check that your warrant of fitness is current to within 1 month
record the modification on your vehicle ownership papers

Question: How close can you park your vehicle to the approach side of a pedestrian crossing where no broken yellow lines have been marked?
What is the best way to check for hazards before reversing your vehicle?

Answers.Answer: Relying only on the outside mirrors
Turning to look over your shoulders
Relying only on the inside mirrors
Walking around the vehicle before reversing

Question: What does a reflectorised triangle placed on the side of the road mean?
